posts.raw_content:
I’ve been sitting on this for a couple of weeks, but I really need to get it out.

For the past 15 years, I lived in a small home where I hosted Bible studies, potlocks, and other low-key gatherings with people from my church. We welcomed our first child late last year, and when he became mobile this year, my wife and I decided that we needed more space, not just to accommodate our son moving around, but so that we could actually child-proof the home as we couldn't with our current place (imagine an older home without built-in fixtures, and the light switches controlled a receptacle for your own lamp... and the kid finding the cord and trying to chew on it).

We sold the old place to a developer and moved into a bigger home this past summer, but with parenthood being so hectic, we never really announced the move to anyone outside of immediate family.

A couple of weeks ago, I swung by the old house to see if any mail for us had shown up. I should note that the developer didn't rent my home out while applying for permits to knock the place and adjacent ones over to build up. Anyways, when I got there, I noticed a hole in one of the windows, and upon looking in, there were what looked like scorch marks on the ceiling. While grabbing the mail, I found a handwritten note addressed to me that said “Get Charlie Kirk’d, fascist,” signed with an Ⓐ symbol. I’m assuming that’s meant to be anarchist/Antifa-related.

What really unsettles me is that only people from church ever came to that house and otherwise knew I lived there. They knew I had a child. And someone still thought it was ok to throw a molotov cocktail into the place thinking I still lived there. I’m honestly stunned and still trying to wrap my head around it.

Just needed to get that off my chest.

At this point, I don't think we'll entertain any guests at our new home.
posts.author: CanucklePede
posts.title: Antifa/Anarchists threw a molotov cocktail into my home and told me to get Charlie Kirk'd

posts.raw_content:
Remember when he got booed about the vaccine?  He stopped talking about it and defending it.  Frankly I'm hoping an opportunity for him to be booed over H1B, 50 year mortgages, Israel, etc... arises.  It's not because I hate him.  It's because that seems to be what he responds to.

Don't stop speaking up about legitimate things you take issue with.  Pretending we're fine with things we find unacceptable is the worst thing we can do right now.
posts.author: HeavenlyTrumpets
posts.title: What is my hope right now?  Simply that Trump likes to be popular, and likes to be liked.  That alone is sufficient reason not to quietly sit by and be supportive as he says or does things we don't like.  Speak up and don't stop.  That isn't the end of "MAGA."  MAGA is about Americans.  Us.
